response.overview: Isla Flotante begins with a phone call between the artist and their cousin, recalling a father’s comment that Puerto Rico shifts a few centimeters each day. This quiet detail unfolds into a layered meditation on colonialism—U.S. occupation, forced migration, environmental crisis, and political abandonment. Through voice and image, the film traces the ways Puerto Ricans are made to drift in and out of their homeland, caught between memory and imposed distance. The “floating island” becomes both a metaphor and a reality: always tethered, never fully free. - re:assemblage collective
response.title: Isla Flotante
